chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Solicit, Direct, Use a Person Under 18 Years of Age to Purchase Pseudoephedrine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent N. Boeldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the jail sentences imposed on 21 CF 496.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination; at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Further proceedings on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:47 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brent N. Boeldt appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Brent N. Boeldt. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial. Inducement contained in 06-16-22 offer memo.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defense counsel for waiver of time limits of preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-22-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Purchase pseudoephedrine on behalf of another to manufacture methamphetamine, on 03-25-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of purchase pseudoephedrine on behalf of another to manufacture methamphetamine.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
